data.name: Wild Boar
data.note: Wild boar

data.name: Jaguar
data.note: Wild jaguar. Same as wolf on yucatan and other americas maps.

data.name: Wolf
data.note: Wild wolf. no food just kills people. LOS also depends on difficulty.

data.name: Deer
data.note: Wild deers running around

data.name: Turkey
data.note: Alternatives to sheep

data.name: Sheep
data.note: Can be picked up by player and used to scout.

data.name: Horse
data.note: Can be used as scout.

data.name: Militia
data.note: Basic infantry swordsman. Quick and cheap to create.

civb.Goths: Cost starting feudal 39F 13G, +1 attack against buildings
civb.Vikings: 44 HP in Feudal, 46 HP in Castle, 48 HP in Imperial Age

data.name: Man-at-arms
data.note: Stronger than Militia. Attack bonus vs. buildings.

civb.Vikings: 50 HP in Feudal, 52 HP in Castle, 54 HP in Imperial Age

data.name: Long Swordsman
data.note: Stronger than Man-at-Arms. Attack bonus vs. buildings.

civb.Vikings: 63 HP in Castle, 66 HP in Imperial Age

data.name: Two-handed Swordsman
data.note: Stronger than Long Swordsman. Attack bonus vs. buildings.

data.name: Champion
data.note: Stronger than Two-Handed Swordsman.

data.name: Spearman

extra.attack bonus: +1 eagles, +1 buildings, +15 war elephants, +15 cavalry, +7 camels/ships

civb.Vikings: 50 HP in Feudal, 52 HP in Castle, 54 HP in Imperial Age

data.note: Medium infantry. Since war elephants are also cavalry, the attack bonus is +30

data.name: Pikeman

extra.attack bonus: +1 eagles, +1 buildings, +25 war elephants, +22 cavalry, +11 camels/ships

civb.Vikings: 63 HP in Castle, 66 HP in Imperial Age

data.note: Stronger than Spearman. Since war elephants are also cavalry, the attack bonus is +47

data.name: Halberdier

extra.attack bonus: +1 eagles, +1 buildings, +28 war elephants, +32 cavalry, +16 camels/ships

data.note: Stronger than Pikeman. Since war elephants are also cavalry, the attack bonus is +60

data.name: Eagle Warrior
data.note: Fast infantry with extensive sight; resists conversion; attack bonus vs. Monks

data.name: Eagle Warrior
data.note: Fast infantry with extensive sight; resists conversion; attack bonus vs. Monks

data.name: Elite Eagle Warrior
data.note: Stronger than Eagle Warrior.

data.name: Archer

civb.Briton: 5 RA 8 LOS from Castle 6 RA 9 LOS from Imperial Age
civb.Mayans: Cost 23W 41G in Feudal, 20W 36G in Castle, 18W 32G in Imperial Age

data.note: Quick and light. Weak at close range; excels at battle from distance.

data.name: Crossbowman

civb.Briton: 5 RA 8 LOS from Castle 6 RA 9 LOS from Imperial Age
civb.Mayans: Cost 23W 41G in Feudal, 20W 36G in Castle, 18W 32G in Imperial Age

data.note: Stronger than archer

data.name: Arbalest

civb.Briton: 5 RA 8 LOS from Castle 6 RA 9 LOS from Imperial Age
civb.Mayans: Cost 23W 41G in Feudal, 20W 36G in Castle, 18W 32G in Imperial Age

data.note: Stronger than crossbowman

data.name: Cavalry Archer

civb.Huns: Costs 30W 53G in Castle age (-25% bonus), 28W 49G in Imperial Age (-30% bonus)

data.note: Fast, with ranged attack. Ideal for hit-and-run attacks.

data.name: Heavy Cavalry Archer

civb.Huns: Costs 30W 53G in Castle age (-25% bonus), 28W 49G in Imperial Age (-30% bonus)

data.note: Stronger than Cavalry Archer.

data.name: Hand Cannoneer
data.note: Powerful close attack; inaccurate at range. Attack bonus against spearman +11 in total

data.name: Skirmisher
data.note: Ranged unit equipped with armor vs. archer attacks.

data.name: Elite Skirmisher

extra.attack bonus: +3 spearmen, +4 archers/hand cannon/skirms/conquistadors, +2 against cavalry archers

data.note: Stronger than skirmisher; Attack bonus against cavalry archers +6 in total (+4 against archers + 2 against cav archers).

data.name: Scout Cavalry
data.note: Fast with extensive line of sight. Resistant to conversion +2 LOS per age

data.name: Scout Cavalry
data.note: Fast with extensive line of sight. Resistant to conversion +2 LOS per age

data.name: Light Cavalry
data.note: Stronger than scout cavalry +2 LOS per age

data.name: Hussar
data.note: Stronger than light cavalry +2 LOS per age

data.name: Knight
data.note: Fast and heavy cavalry.

data.name: Cavalier
data.note: Stronger than knight

data.name: Paladin
data.note: Stronger than cavalier

data.name: Camel
data.note: Excels at killing other mounted units. (not classified as cavalry)

data.name: Heavy Camel
data.note: Stronger than Camel. Attack bonus vs. cavalry. (not classified as cavalry)

data.name: Mangonel
data.note: Wheeled siege weapon used to attack a small mass of units. Area of effect attack. Can attack ground. Weak vs. close nonranged units.

data.name: Onager
data.note: Stronger than mangonel

data.name: Siege Onager
data.note: Stronger than onager

data.name: Scorpion
data.note: damage to all units in the path

data.name: Heavy Scorpion
data.note: damage to all units in the path

data.name: Battering Ram

extra.attack bonus: +125 (+165 full) buildings, +40 siege, +150 (+190 full) with siege engineers buildings

data.note: Slow, lumbering siege weapon used to reduce enemy towns to ruins. The movement rate is affected by the number of infantry units garrisoned (maxiumum of 4 units)

data.name: Capped Ram

extra.attack bonus: +150 (+190 full) buildings, +50 siege, +180 (+220 full) with siege engineers buildings

data.note: Stronger than battering ram. Can garrison 4 units. The movement rate is affected by the number of infantry units garrisoned, max speed at 0.7

data.name: Siege Ram

extra.attack bonus: +200 (+260 full) buildings, +65 siege, +240 (+300 full) with siege engineers buildings

data.note: Stronger than capped ram. The movement rate is affected by the number of infantry units garrisoned (maxiumum of 6 units garrisoned)

data.name: Bombard Cannon
data.note: Powerful mobile anti-building siege weapon.

data.name: Trebuchet (packed)
data.note: Powerful siege weapon used to destroy buildings, walls from long distance. Cannot fire on close units. Must be packed to move, unpacked to attack. Can cut paths through forests. Unpack time: 0:11

data.name: Petard
data.note: Demolition infantry unit armed with explosives. Bonuses add up - for example against walls and gates: +500 buildings +900 walls = +1400 bonus attack.

data.name: King
data.note: Cannot be produced, so cost and build time just for the sake of interest.

data.name: Berserk

civb.Vikings: base HP 48, but thanks to viking bonus HP in castle age: 55 in Imperial: 58

data.note: Viking unique unit. Infantry that slowly heals itself.

data.name: Elite Berserk

civb.Vikings: base HP 60 thanks to viking bonus 72 HP in imperial

data.note: Viking unique unit. Stronger than Berserk.

data.name: Cataphract
data.note: Byzantine unique unit. Heavily armored cavalry.

data.name: Elite Cataphract
data.note: Byzantine elite unique unit. Heavily armored cavalry.

data.name: Chu Ko Nu

extra.reload time: 3, but the multiple missiles cause roughly 0.6 delay

civb.Saracen ally: +2 attack against buildings for first arrow

data.note: Chinese unique unit. Archer with mediocre range. Shoots a volley of 2 extra arrows with 3 attack.  Because of the multiple arrows, the delay between starts of attacks is more, roughly 3.6.

data.name: Elite Chu Ko Nu

extra.reload time: 3, but the multiple missiles cause roughly 0.75 delay

civb.Saracen ally: +2 attack against buildings for first arrow

data.note: Chinese unique unit. Stronger than Chu Ko Nu. Shoots a volley of 4 extra arrows with 3 attack. Because of the multiple arrows, the delay between starts of attacks is more, roughly 3.75.

data.name: Conquistador
data.note: Spanish unique unit. Mounted Hand Cannoneer. Powerful close attack, but inaccurate at range. (Only archer armor upgrades apply from blacksmith, not range or attack).

data.name: Elite Conquistador
data.note: Spanish elite unique unit. Mounted Hand Cannoneer. Powerful close attack, but inaccurate at range. (Only archer armor upgrades apply from blacksmith, not range or attack).

data.name: Huskarl

civb.Goths: +1 against buildings, making it +3; base cost 80F 40G; 0:13.33BT from barracks

data.note: Gothic unique unit. Infantry with substantial pierce armor; virtually immune to archer fire. Attack bonus vs. buildings, archers.

data.name: Elite Huskarl

civb.Goths: +1 against buildings (making it +4); base cost 80F 40G; 0:13.33BT from barracks

data.note: Gothic elite unique unit. Stronger than Huskarl.

data.name: Jaguar Warrior

civb.Aztec: base BT 20, but with aztec bonus 20*0.85 = 17 seconds

data.note: Aztec unique unit. Attack bonus vs. other infantry. (bonus attacks stack so +12 bonus against eagles)

data.name: Elite Jaguar Warrior

civb.Aztec: base BT 20, but with aztec bonus 20*0.85 = 17 seconds

data.note: Aztec elite unique unit. Attack bonus vs. other infantry. (bonus attacks stack so +12 bonus against eagles)

data.name: Janissary

civb.Turks:
base creation time 21 seconds, but the -20% bonus makes it 0:17;
Base HP 35, but 25% HP bonus -> 44 HP

data.note: Turkish unique unit. Hand Cannoneer with longer range and no minimum range.

data.name: Elite Janissary

civb.Turks:
base creation time 21 seconds, but the -20% bonus makes it 0:17;
Base HP 40, but 25% HP bonus -> 50 HP

data.note: Turkish elite unique unit. Hand Cannoneer with longer range and no minimum range.

data.name: Longbowman

civb.Britons: base 5 RA 7 LOS, with bonus 6 RA 8 LOS in Castle 7 RA 9 LOS in Imperial

data.note: British unique unit. Powerful archer with long range.

data.name: Elite Longbowman

civb.Britons: base 6 RA 8 LOS, with bonus 8 RA 10 LOS in Imperial

data.note: British unique unit. Powerful archer with long range.

data.name: Mameluke
data.note: Saracen unique unit. Camel with hand-to-hand attack at distance. Excels vs. other mounted units.

data.name: Elite Mameluke
data.note: Saracen elite unique unit. Camel with hand-to-hand attack at distance. Excels vs. other mounted units.

data.name: Mangudai

civb.Mongols: Base reload time 2.1, but -20% reload time with mongols

data.note: Mongol unique unit. Cavalry archer with attack bonus vs. siege weapons.

data.name: Elite Mangudai

civb.Mongols: Base reload time 2.1, but -20% reload time with mongols

data.note: Mongol elite unique unit. Cavalry archer with attack bonus vs. siege weapons

data.name: Plumed Archer

civb.Mayans: Base cost 46W 46G -> 37W 37G in Castle, 32W 32G in Imperial age

data.note: Mayan unique unit. Strong, fast, well-armored archer with less attack than other archers.

data.name: Elite Plumed Archer

civb.Mayans: Base cost 46W 46G -> 37W 37G in Castle, 32W 32G in Imperial age

data.note: Mayan elite unique unit. Strong, fast, well-armored archer with less attack than other archers.

data.name: Samurai

civb.Japanese: base reload time 1.9, thanks to bonus (-25%) 1.425

data.note: Japanese unique unit. Infantry with fast attack. Attack bonus vs. other unique units, buildings.

data.name: Elite Samurai

civb.Japanese: base reload time 1.9, thanks to bonus (-25%) 1.425

data.note: Japanese elite unique unit. Infantry with fast attack. Attack bonus vs. other unique units, buildings.

data.name: Tarkan

extra.attack bonus: +10 castle, +8 buildings, +12 stone defense, +8 walls and gates

data.note: Hun unique unit. Cavalry with attack bonus vs. buildings. (Attack bonuses stack - for example +16 against a palisade wall (8 buildings + 8 walls))

data.name: Elite Tarkan

extra.attack bonus: +10 castle, +10 buildings, +12 stone defense, +10 walls and gates

data.note: Hun elite unique unit. Cavalry with attack bonus vs. buildings. (Attack bonuses stack - for example +20 against castles (10+10))

data.name: Teutonic Knight
data.note: +4 buildings, +4 eagle warriors

data.name: Elite Teutonic Knight
data.note: Teutonic elite unique unit. Infantry with effective armor and slow but powerful attack.

data.name: Throwing Axeman
data.note: Frankish unique unit. Infantry with ranged attack.

data.name: Elite Throwing Axeman
data.note: Frankish elite unique unit. Infantry with ranged attack

data.name: War Elephant
data.note: Persian unique unit. Slow, powerful, strong, and well-armored cavalry.

data.name: Elite War Elephant
data.note: Persian unique unit. Slow, powerful, strong, and well-armored cavalry. Does trample damage in a surrounding area (see blast radius).

data.name: War Wagon
data.note: Korean unique unit. Heavily armored horse-drawn archery unit.

data.name: Elite War Wagon
data.note: Korean elite unique unit. Heavily armored horse-drawn archery unit.

data.name: Woad Raider

extra.base movement rate: 1.2, but because of the celts bonus 1.2*1.15 = 1.38

data.note: Celtic unique unit. Exceptionally quick infantry. Attack bonus vs. buildings.

data.name: Elite Woad Raider

extra.base movement rate: 1.2, but because of the celts bonus 1.2*1.15 = 1.38

data.note: Celtic elite unique unit. Stronger than Woad Raider.

civb.Japanese:
120 HP 0/6 armor (+2 pierce armor);
work rate +5% in Dark, +10% in Feudal, +15% in Castle, +20% in Imperial Age
civb.Persians: 0:36.36 BT in Feudal, 0:34.78 BT in Castle, 0:33.33 BT in Imperial

data.name: Trade Cog

civb.Persians: 0:32.73 BT in Feudal, 0:31.3 BT in Castle, 0:30 BT in Imperial

data.note: Movement rate 2.00 with caravan

data.name: Transport Ship

civb.Persians: 0:40.91 BT in Feudal, 0:39.13 BT in Castle, 0:37.5 BT in Imperial
civb.Saracens: 200 HP, Garrison 10 inside (15 with careening, 25 with dry dock)

data.note: Garrison inside 5 (10 with careening, 20 with dry dock)

data.name: Galley

civb.Persians: 0:54.55 BT in Feudal, 0:52.17 BT in Castle, 0:50 BT in Imperial

data.note: Small, fast ship with weak attack. Used to scout the water and for early attacks on enemy fishing fleets.

data.name: War Galley

civb.Persians: 0:31.3 BT in Castle, 0:30 BT in Imperial

data.note: Stronger than Galley.

data.name: Galleon
data.note: +11 ships, 4 ram, 8 buildings

data.name: Fire Ship

civb.Persians: 0:31.3 BT in Castle, 0:30 BT in Imperial

data.note: Spews fire at other ships. Good at sinking galleys. Attack shows pierce attack.

data.name: Fast Fire Ship
data.note: Spews fire at other ships and fast. Good at sinking galleys. Attack shows pierce attack.

data.name: Demolition Ship

civb.Persians: 0:26.96 BT in Castle, 0:25.83 BT in Imperial

data.note: Filled with explosives. Self-destructs when used. Pilot near enemy ships and detonate to wrest control of the sea from an entrenched opponent.

data.name: Heavy Demolition Ship
data.note: Filled with explosives. Self-destructs when used. Pilot near enemy ships and detonate to wrest control of the sea from an entrenched opponent.

data.name: Cannon Galleon
data.note: Long-range warship used to attack targets on shore to establish beachhead. Fires slowly, with minimum range.

data.name: Elite Cannon Galleon
data.note: Long-range warship used to attack targets on shore to establish beachhead. Fires slowly, with minimum range.

data.name: Longboat

extra.reload time: 3, but because of the multiple arrows it get delayed

data.note: Viking unique unit. Fires multiple arrows. volley of 4 arrows (7-1-1-1). Castle needed. Because of the multiple arrows, the delay between starts of attacks is roughly 3.34.

data.name: Elite Longboat

extra.reload time: 3, but because of the multiple arrows it get delayed

data.note: Viking elite unique unit. Stronger than Longboat. Fires multiple arrows. volley of 4 arrows (8-1-1-1). Because of the multiple arrows, the delay between starts of attacks is roughly 3.34.

data.name: Turtle Ship
data.note: Korean unique unit. Slow, ironclad battleship used to destroy other ships at close range.

data.name: Elite Turtle Ship
data.note: Korean elite unique unit. Slow, ironclad battleship used to destroy other ships at close range.

data.name: Villager

extra.sappers: +15 attack bonus against buildings and stone defenses

civb.Goths: +5 attack vs boar, hunters carry +15 food
civb.Persians: 0:22.73 BT in Feudal, 0:21.74 BT in Castle, 0:20.83 in Imperial Age

data.note: Gathers wood, food, stone, gold. Builds and repairs buildings. Also repairs ships, siege weapons.

data.name: Monk
data.note: Slow and weak. Converts enemy units, ships to your civilization (player color). Heals wounded villagers, military units (except siege weapons)

data.name: Missionary
data.note: castle needed, mounted monk

data.name: Trade Cart
data.note: Used to trade with other players by land. Carries goods from your Market to another player's Market and brings back gold. The farther the Market, the higher your profit. To trade, click the Trade Cart, then right-click an allied or neutral Market.
